meanings.definition: In a way that is perpendicular to the horizon or ground.
meanings.sent1: The flag waved vertically in the wind.
meanings.sent2: She stacked the books vertically on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel climbed vertically up the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The elevator moved vertically between floors.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall cascaded vertically down the cliff.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is aligned with the direction of gravity.
meanings.sent1: The raindrops fell vertically from the sky.
meanings.sent2: The rock fell vertically to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched vertically before jumping down.
meanings.sent4: The acrobat hung vertically from the trapeze.
meanings.sent5: The seeds planted vertically in the soil sprouted quickly.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is oriented in an up-and-down direction.
meanings.sent1: The elevator moved vertically between floors.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster went vertically up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar crawled vertically up the stem.
meanings.sent4: The thermometer showed the temperature rising vertically.
meanings.sent5: The vines grew vertically along the trellis.
